bioghist.p: The New York Maternal Association was formed in 1818. The main Association was composed of subordinate chapters attached to individual Presbyterian churches throughout the city. At monthly meetings of these chapters, mothers and their children met for prayer and conversation, the purpose being to instruct children in the faith. These individual chapters came together for a semiannual meeting; this constituted the New York Maternal Association. At these semiannual meetings, each constituent member chapter reported on their activities in the previous year. Some of the group's annual reports were published in the Mother's Magazine.

scopecontent.p: This is a volume of minutes of the New York Maternal Association. The volume includes copies of correspondence to the New York Maternal Association, brief histories of member chapters, and minutes of annual and semiannual meetings, 1832-1869. The volume also includes a list of the founding members of the New York Maternal Association and some historical sketches and correspondence related to the history of the Association, 1869-1880.
